content.description:
This is the large splitter thats shaped like an "S" on the Left page of the open book.  Original start is the same as

The Downclimb

on a ledge in the center of the book go up a right facing corner "small" finger crack 5.6 then up and left under the splitter.  Fingers to OW, very physical and well Protected.  5.9 moves into and up around the middle.
content.protection: Pro to 5", a few med nuts at the start and a #1-5 camelot would be fine. Bring .5 and an extra #3 for belay
content.location: To decend head over the large boulder that is round leaning against the large "halfdome" shaped boulder.  Slings are place around the boulder, 1 rope gets down into the gully.

content.description: This Line takes the center flake system with " the fingers" about 3/4 of the way up. Start 15 feet up 3rd class on a ledge with a large section to the left. Head up the wide section to a horizontal crack/roof, head out and right along the crack up onto the slab.  Move into the right crack system and belay at a stance where there is separation of the fingers to the flake with a 1" crack running up the middle.  5.7 moves out of the belay over the bulge and into the sustained crack, move up and over the top of the flake and belay with large pieces around the boulders, put in directional at the top of the flake for the second.
content.location:
The center formation following a flake/pillar up to the black fingers and to the top of the flake with a 20 Ft crack running straight up the center.  Tribal Line lies on the west face of Mislaid Rock to the right of

Fender Bender

.

content.description:
20 ft to the left of

Tribal Line

there is a crescent shaped ramp that move up and right into a wide section 5.7.  Belay above wide section or be prepared for drag! Move left onto the traversing ledge that move up and left along the side of Mislaid Rock.  Finish with a hand crack to a 10x15 ledge.  4th class up to the left of

Tribal Line

and descend on the south side.
content.protection: Pro to 4" 1st belay takes .5-.75 and med nuts. 2nd belay takes big stuff.
content.location: Descend around to the right over a round boulder set against the "halfdome" shaped boulder.  slings are down on the left and 1 rap takes you to the gully.

content.description: This is the center or corner line up the large open book.  It starts at the 5.6 finger crack in the center and heads up the hand to OW crack in the spine of the Book.  Great climb to do in the evening on quality rock!
content.protection: Pro to 4" + #3 for belay along with med stoppers.
content.location: Head over the large round boulder against the "Halfdome" shaped boulder, down to the left to find slings  and make 1 rappel into the gully.
